intro: Centranthera grandiflora, commonly known as the large-flowered centranthera, is a member of the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and legume fruits. It is a perennial herb native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico, thriving in arid and semi-arid environments. The plant produces striking, showy flowers that are typically pink or purple, with a distinctive spurred structure at the base of the petals. Its root system is well-developed, allowing it to survive in poor soils and withstand periods of drought. The leaves are trifoliate, with each leaflet being ovate to lanceolate in shape.
